intro: Madia gracilis subsp. pilosa, commonly known as the softleaf madia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and hairy foliage, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its subspecies name, *pilosa*, refers to the soft, hairy texture of its leaves.
